shortDescription: Colors appear unusually vivid, saturated, and emotionally prominent.
simulationHints: Boost saturation and vibrance with hue protection
Increase local contrast in midtones without crushing blacks
Add subtle bloom on bright, colorful highlights
Optionally add slow chroma pulses for a living feel

shortDescription: Tonal separation feels heightened, giving edges and textures a hyper-crisp look.
simulationHints: Increase local contrast (clarity) more than global contrast
Use edge-aware sharpening to avoid halos and ringing
Stabilize micro-contrast over time to prevent shimmer
Protect smooth gradients (skin, skies) from banding

shortDescription: Fine detail feels hyper-clear, like focus and resolution were turned up.
simulationHints: Add edge-aware sharpening plus micro-contrast
Reduce chroma noise while keeping luminance detail
Boost texture detail selectively (foliage, fabric, bark)
Keep sharpening temporally stable to avoid sparkle

shortDescription: Ambiguous textures seem to resolve into meaningful patterns, faces, and symbols.
simulationHints: Increase mid-frequency feature salience (edges, corners, repeats)
Blend extremely low-strength semantic priors without hard overlays
Bias emergence to peripheral and low-attention regions
Let patterns flicker in and out instead of staying fixed

shortDescription: Distant details seem zoomed-in and closer than they should be.
simulationHints: Apply localized zoom centered on a gaze or subject anchor
Use depth-aware scaling to bring far layers forward subtly
Add slight acuity enhancement to emphasize distant detail
Keep perspective consistent and avoid fisheye warping

shortDescription: Motion feels slowed down because visual events feel easier to track and parse.
simulationHints: Reduce motion blur and increase clarity on fast-moving edges
Add mild motion sharpening without strobing
Increase micro-detail visibility during motion (temporal supersampling feel)
Keep motion continuous; avoid hard frame holds

shortDescription: Bright regions bloom into soft auras and haloes around edges.
simulationHints: Add bloom with a soft knee and wide radius
Use luminance-based glow rather than uniform blur
Let glow pick up local light color for plausibility
Avoid thick edge halos that read as posterization

shortDescription: Surface textures feel unusually rich and attention-grabbing.
simulationHints: Boost micro-contrast in textured regions
Enhance repeating detail with subtle frequency amplification
Keep motion coherent so textures feel alive, not noisy
Avoid crunchy HDR artifacts and edge ringing

shortDescription: Colors lose saturation and distinction, drifting toward muted or grayscale.
simulationHints: Reduce saturation and vibrance, especially in midtones
Compress hue separation (lower chroma contrast)
Bias desaturation to shadows and periphery for a dim feel
Optionally approach monochrome at extreme intensity

shortDescription: Objects appear doubled or misaligned, as if binocular images will not fuse.
simulationHints: Render a faint displaced duplicate with a horizontal offset
Increase separation with intensity while keeping it temporally stable
Slightly blur or dim the secondary image to reduce readability
Avoid kaleidoscope-like splitting; keep it a simple diplopia

shortDescription: Visual information feels harder to interpret even when it is clear and sharp.
simulationHints: Lower mid-level feature integration without heavy blur
Soften object boundaries and reduce distinguishing cues slightly
Increase ambiguous textures and reduce semantic clarity
Keep large shapes readable to avoid turning it into acuity suppression

shortDescription: Peripheral details briefly look like something else until directly inspected.
simulationHints: Add transient peripheral pareidolia: brief hints of people, objects, or motion
Keep misinterpretations fleeting and self-correcting when looked at
Bias artifacts to edges of frame and low-attention regions
Avoid stable inserts; aim for momentary misreads

shortDescription: Vision becomes blurred and indistinct, like an out-of-focus lens.
simulationHints: Apply soft edge diffusion and small-radius blur
Prefer lens-like defocus over uniform Gaussian mush
Reduce fine texture contrast while preserving broad shapes
Optionally add slight directional blur (astigmatism-like)

shortDescription: Visual updates feel choppy or laggy, like a buffering or strobing frame rate drop.
simulationHints: Add temporal quantization: hold frames briefly, then jump
Use subtle step motion rather than smooth blur
Increase motion ghosting and persistence at higher intensity
Avoid harsh flicker that reads as a video artifact

shortDescription: Surfaces subtly expand and contract in a slow rhythmic pulse.
simulationHints: Apply low-frequency displacement locked to surfaces (UV or optical-flow)
Drive expansion and contraction with smooth oscillation (sine or noise)
Keep edges anchored to avoid camera-like wobble
Scale motion with depth so flat planes breathe more than silhouettes

shortDescription: Textures and shapes slowly warp and slide as if the scene is melting in place.
simulationHints: Use optical-flow aligned warping for temporal coherence
Add curl-noise displacement that grows with stare-time
Keep motion slow and spatially coherent (no global camera shake)
Optionally ease back to baseline to mimic a 'double-take' reset

shortDescription: Fine textures stream like a liquid current, often in looping patterns.
simulationHints: Advect texture coordinates along a low-velocity vector field
Add divergence-free curl for organic flow
Confine flow to high-detail surfaces (foliage, fur, grain)
Keep motion loopable and temporally stable

shortDescription: Edges sag, drip, or liquefy as if structures lose rigidity.
simulationHints: Apply anisotropic downward displacement with viscosity-like smoothing
Soften hard edges and increase edge diffusion
Bias deformation to high-salience shapes and contours
Avoid turning it into simple blur; keep recognizable forms

shortDescription: Objects subtly change shape or identity while remaining partially anchored.
simulationHints: Use segmentation-guided warps to preserve object boundaries
Interpolate between plausible shape variants over time
Add mild texture substitution rather than full replacement
Keep transformations slow, continuous, and reversible

shortDescription: Moving objects leave lingering trails, like long-exposure streaks.
simulationHints: Accumulate prior frames with exponential decay
Use motion vectors or optical flow to align trails
Make trails stronger on bright and high-contrast edges
Clamp trail length to avoid full-frame smear at low intensity

shortDescription: Visual impressions linger as ghosted silhouettes after the stimulus moves or disappears.
simulationHints: Blend a delayed frame buffer with separate luminance and chroma decay
Add negative or positive afterimage variants at higher intensity
Keep afterimages semi-transparent and slowly fading
Let afterimages drift slightly for a subtle ghost effect

shortDescription: Overall brightness shifts darker or lighter than baseline in a noticeable way.
simulationHints: Apply global exposure shift with gentle highlight rolloff
Add slow brightness drift that responds to scene luminance
Keep highlights from clipping and preserve shadow detail
Optionally pair with bloom changes for a pupil-dilation feel

shortDescription: Specific areas or the whole scene adopt a different stable color than expected.
simulationHints: Replace selected hue bands with alternate hues using masks
Keep the replacement mostly stable (not cycling)
Preserve luminance and texture while swapping chroma
Avoid posterization; keep smooth gradients

shortDescription: Colors continuously cycle through hues in smooth waves across surfaces.
simulationHints: Animate hue rotation with low-frequency spatial phase
Bias cycling to colorful and high-salience regions
Keep motion smooth and loopable; avoid strobing
Preserve shading by applying shifts in HSV/HSL space

shortDescription: The entire visual field takes on a translucent color wash, like a filter overlay.
simulationHints: Apply a global color overlay with low opacity
Tint shadows slightly more than highlights
Keep tint stable to distinguish from color shifting
Add subtle vignetting to increase immersion

shortDescription: Depth layers feel rearranged, exaggerated, flattened, or swapped in order.
simulationHints: Use depth maps to warp scale and parallax nonlinearly
Swap or compress depth layers via subtle compositing
Add contradictory focus cues (blur vs distance) at higher intensity
Keep occlusion consistent to avoid obvious cutouts

shortDescription: Bright areas show rainbow fringes and spectral splitting, like prismatic glare.
simulationHints: Add chromatic aberration around highlights and specular edges
Use spectral bloom that spreads into subtle rainbow bands
Increase effect at high-luminance edges and light sources
Keep it localized; avoid global RGB separation

shortDescription: Scale and distance cues shift, making the world feel stretched, closer, or far away.
simulationHints: Modulate field-of-view and lens distortion over time
Use depth-aware scaling to create near and far exaggeration
Keep horizon and verticals mostly stable to avoid camera shake
Reserve extreme fisheye warps for high intensity

shortDescription: The visual field stretches horizontally or vertically, sometimes into an elongated strip.
simulationHints: Apply non-uniform scaling anchored at center or gaze point
Add vignetting or void margins at extreme stretch
Keep stretch smooth over time; avoid jitter
Optionally reveal subtle geometry in side space at high intensity

shortDescription: The scene segments into square or cubic tiles that drift apart, revealing gaps.
simulationHints: Quantize the image into blocky segments (grid or adaptive tiles)
Animate tiles drifting away from their original position
Fill gaps with dark void or tightly-bound geometry
Keep edges clean and planar for a cubist feel

shortDescription: Textures evolve into symmetrical geometric patterns while still made from the original material.
simulationHints: Apply symmetry transforms to repeating textures (mirror or kaleidoscope)
Seed patterns from existing texture features (edges and repeats)
Increase complexity with intensity: lattices, fractals, and form constants
Keep patterning surface-embedded and perspective-aligned

shortDescription: The environment breaks into circular or orb-like segments that drift and leave gaps.
simulationHints: Segment the scene into circular cells (Voronoi or bubble partition)
Animate orbs drifting and resizing over time
Reveal dark or geometry-filled gaps between orbs
Keep segmentation coherent; avoid random noise circles

shortDescription: Objects appear to warp and animate in 3D space in unpredictable but plausible ways.
simulationHints: Use depth and segmentation to warp object volumes without tearing backgrounds
Add slow bend, tilt, and elongation rather than violent mesh breakup
Preserve texture identity while altering 3D form
Optionally reset when gaze shifts to mimic a 'double-take' correction

shortDescription: Parts of the scene repeat within themselves, creating Droste-like self-similar loops.
simulationHints: Apply iterative scale-and-inset feedback (Droste) on a stable region
Blend recursion softly to avoid hard borders and seams
Keep it brief and intermittent rather than constant
Center recursion on salient shapes like horizons or windows

shortDescription: The view splits into clean slices that drift away and then snap back.
simulationHints: Cut the scene into stripes or geometric slices with sharp boundaries
Animate slices drifting and slightly rotating before resetting
Keep the effect brief and spontaneous rather than constant
Coordinate with cubism or orbism styles at higher intensity

shortDescription: Textures mirror and tessellate into intricate repeating symmetry, often strongest in the periphery.
simulationHints: Mirror textures across multiple axes to create symmetry
Prefer rough detail textures (grass, carpet, bark) as inputs
Increase tessellation density and symmetry order with intensity
Keep detail level consistent when zooming in

shortDescription: Textures simplify and smear into a painterly, cartoon-like stylization.
simulationHints: Reduce high-frequency detail while preserving edges
Use bilateral filtering and subtle posterization for a painted look
Add gentle brush-stroke flow aligned with surface direction
Avoid turning it into plain blur; keep stylized structure

shortDescription: The scene abruptly appears rotated, mirrored, or flipped into a different orientation.
simulationHints: Apply discrete 90° or 180° rotations or mirroring as quick events
Use easing and brief duration to avoid nausea
Combine with slight stretching and double vision at higher intensity
Keep the flip global rather than per-object

shortDescription: The air looks shrouded in foggy haze, reducing clarity and contrast.
simulationHints: Add depth-dependent fog with low-frequency variation
Reduce contrast and sharpness slightly, especially at distance
Add subtle volumetric bloom around light sources
Keep haze stable and not like video noise

shortDescription: A fine static-like noise overlays vision, similar to visual snow or eigengrau.
simulationHints: Add low-amplitude grain with temporal correlation (not pure random)
Bias noise to shadows and dark fields for a closed-eye feel
Keep speckle fine and uniform, not blocky compression
Optionally add faint colored speckle at higher intensity

shortDescription: Unstructured flashes and clouds of color appear, like phosphene-like fields.
simulationHints: Add soft color clouds with low-frequency motion
Use additive blending on a dark background for a closed-eye feel
Animate with gentle turbulence rather than rigid patterns
Avoid hard edges; keep it amorphous and smooth

shortDescription: Vague 2D geometric patterns emerge as a fine veil, often dark and limited in palette.
simulationHints: Overlay faint 2D line and shape fields with small scale detail
Use a restricted dark palette (deep reds, purples, blacks)
Increase structure gradually from noise into recognizable motifs
Prefer low light and closed-eye style presentation

shortDescription: Intricate 2D geometry becomes crisp and highly structured across a veil in front of vision.
simulationHints: Generate dense tessellations and repeating motifs
Expand palette and contrast versus partially defined geometry
Animate patterns smoothly (rotation, phase shifts, breathing)
Keep it layered but still planar (a 2D veil)

shortDescription: Geometry becomes 3D and appears attached to surfaces and objects in the environment.
simulationHints: Project patterns onto surfaces using depth and normal cues
Add parallax and shading to sell 3D structure
Keep geometry surface-embedded and perspective-aligned
Increase symmetry and complexity with intensity

shortDescription: Geometry becomes intense enough to partially block out the external scene.
simulationHints: Increase geometry opacity and brightness in layered passes
Let objects transform into geometry while preserving silhouettes
Use glow and bloom to make geometry feel luminous
Keep some landmarks visible to maintain partial override

shortDescription: Geometry fully replaces normal sight, creating a breakthrough-like alternate visual world.
simulationHints: Transition from surface-embedded patterns into full-frame geometry takeover
Use deep layered parallax and non-euclidean perspective cues
Maintain coherent motion and avoid noisy randomness
Reserve full replacement for the highest intensity

displayName: 8A Perceived exposure to semantic concept network
shortDescription: Geometry feels like a vast, readable network representing concepts, memories, and associations.
simulationHints: Render branching node-and-link lattices with semantic glyph-like hints
Increase density and interconnectedness toward the center
Use spider-diagram and mind-map motifs without literal text
Make complexity feel infinite via recursion and layered depth

displayName: 8B Perceived exposure to inner mechanics of consciousness
shortDescription: Geometry seems to reveal the underlying machinery of thought and consciousness as readable structure.
simulationHints: Use circuit-like, neural-network, and feedback-loop motifs
Emphasize architecture: gates, layers, recursion, and flow
Add high-dimensional parallax and non-euclidean cues
Keep it abstract; avoid pseudo-scientific labels

shortDescription: Repeating geometric motifs appear on surfaces, often symmetry-driven and texture-bound.
simulationHints: Generate procedural tilings and motifs with controllable symmetry
Lock patterns to surface texture flow using depth and segmentation
Modulate symmetry order over time (e.g., 4 → 6 → 8)
Keep patterns embedded in materials, not floating overlays

shortDescription: A tunnel-like form constant appears, with repeating rings and depth pull toward a center.
simulationHints: Use log-polar mapping to create stable tunnel geometry
Animate slow zoom and rotation in layered passes
Add depth shading and vignetting to sell immersion
Keep motifs surface-embedded when eyes-open geometry is desired

shortDescription: Spiraling forms rotate and expand, often nested or layered.
simulationHints: Generate spiral fields in polar coordinates
Layer multiple harmonic spirals with different radii
Animate rotation smoothly with subtle phase drift
Add glow and depth cues for a 3D feel

shortDescription: Lattices and grids tessellate across the field, forming repeating nets or honeycombs.
simulationHints: Create tiling patterns with enforced symmetry and repetition
Project lattice onto surfaces using depth maps
Add subtle parallax and shading at intersections
Avoid wireframe overlays floating in space

shortDescription: Fine cobweb-like filigree and netting appears, often luminous and radial.
simulationHints: Generate thin line networks with radial spokes and arcs
Vary strand thickness and add faint glow
Keep motion subtle (slow drift) to avoid jitter
Blend with a darker background for contrast

shortDescription: Fractal patterns repeat within themselves, creating infinite zoom-like complexity.
simulationHints: Use iterative feedback and zoom shaders with controlled rotation
Constrain fractal detail to avoid full-frame noise
Cycle colors slowly with a coherent palette
Layer fractals on surfaces rather than as separate objects

shortDescription: Radial symmetric mandala-like structures emerge, often layered and ornate.
simulationHints: Generate radial symmetry with rings and petal-like motifs
Add layered depth shading and subtle breathing scale changes
Use fine ornamentation without harsh edges
Keep the center stable to avoid nausea

shortDescription: The scene or textures mirror into repeating symmetrical tiles like a kaleidoscope.
simulationHints: Apply mirror symmetry transforms around a chosen center
Blend between different symmetry orders over time
Keep tiling texture-bound and perspective-aware
Feather seams to avoid obvious copy-paste edges

shortDescription: With eyes closed or in darkness, vivid patterns and imagery arise behind the eyelids.
simulationHints: Render a full-frame generative layer separate from scene surfaces
Use evolving geometry and color fields that grow in complexity
Keep motion smooth and cohesive rather than noisy
Increase saturation and symmetry at high intensity

shortDescription: Dreamlike internal scenes or narratives appear as immersive imagery.
simulationHints: Transition from abstract geometry into representational scenes
Maintain motif persistence across changes (scene graph feel)
Use soft morphs and crossfades rather than hard cuts
Keep lighting coherent and emotionally toned

shortDescription: Autonomous beings seem present within the experience, with apparent agency.
simulationHints: Let forms emerge from geometry and symmetry first
Keep entities partially ambiguous at moderate intensity
Integrate via occlusion, lighting, and perspective cues
Avoid horror tropes unless explicitly desired

shortDescription: Perception shifts into an entirely different environment, replacing the original scene.
simulationHints: Ramp geometry intensity, then crossfade into a new coherent scene
Preserve camera motion continuity across the transition
Keep thematic anchors (palette, lighting) to make the swap feel plausible
Avoid hard cuts; make it feel like passage

shortDescription: Novel objects appear in the environment with apparent solidity and stable placement.
simulationHints: Insert objects with correct occlusion, shadows, and lighting
Keep behavior mundane and physically plausible
Prefer background or periphery to reduce uncanny artifacts
Avoid duplicating faces or limbs unless explicitly required

shortDescription: Faces and meaningful forms appear in ambiguous textures and noise.
simulationHints: Blend low-confidence face and symbol templates into textures
Bias to peripheral vision and low-detail areas
Let forms flicker in and out rather than staying fixed
Keep it subtle to avoid becoming full external hallucinations

shortDescription: Sounds influence visual motion, color, or structure as if senses are coupled.
simulationHints: Map beat to motion amplitude and rhythm to phase resets
Map spectral centroid to hue and saturation
Map loudness to bloom and contrast changes
Smooth control signals to keep motion coherent

shortDescription: Distances and sizes feel unstable, with objects seeming closer, farther, larger, or smaller.
simulationHints: Use depth maps to modulate scale and blur in a time-varying way
Combine subtle focal-length drift with selective object scaling
Preserve occlusion and edges to avoid cutout artifacts
Avoid extreme fisheye unless intensity is high

shortDescription: Motion is perceived in discrete slices, as if time is segmented into frames.
simulationHints: Use multi-exposure compositing with gated frame holds
Add slight ghosting between slices instead of hard cuts
Modulate gating irregularly for an unstable temporal feel
Avoid high-frequency strobe that reads as camera flicker

shortDescription: Space breaks into slices, panels, loops, or impossible rearrangements.
simulationHints: Use tiling and slicing transforms with hard boundaries
Animate panels with a single dominant direction and slow drift
Keep color changes secondary so it reads as spatial, not decorative
Allow brief resets back to baseline to mimic flickering discontinuity
